title: Ralph and Russo secures $70 million investment
text:
Ralph and Russo, the first Australian fashion label to be invited to France's couture governing body, has received a £40 million (approx AUD$71 million) investment from La Perla Fashion Investment BV.

The share is non-controlling but represents a significant strategic alignment for the brand, which prior to now has seen most of its investment come from private stakeholders.

Michael Russo and Tamara Ralph in their London studio, photographed for AFR LUXURY magazine. Gabby Laurent

The label, founded in 2010 by Australians Tamara Ralph and Michael Russo, is based in London and is known for its dramatic, feminine gowns.

It has developed a cult celebrity following, counting Beyoncé, the Duchess of Sussex and Gwyneth Paltrow among its fans.

In 2014 Ralph and Russo became the first British-based fashion house in a century, and the only Australians ever, to show during Paris Haute Couture Week.
description: The Australian couture label beloved by celebrities has set its sights on international expansion.
